To change the language from German to English :
Open the steam_rld file ,which is in the directory were Wargane Airland Battle is installed ,with notepad.
Change the last line is the file ,which reads Language=german to Language=english.
Now the game is in English.

To change the language from german to english :
Open the steam_rld file ,which is in the installation directory ,with notepad.
Now change the last line in this file ,which reads Language=german to Language=english.
Now the games default language is English.
Yup, german only

I love how many people give up just because the language isn't correct. What people fail to realize is the main release of most games contain multiple languages. Yes, the default is German, but it can be changed. Open the steam file, and change the language inside from German to English. Case closed.

My PC was telling me that I had the distributable DLL file already. Killher's link directs you to a 2010 redist. Here's 2012. 

Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2012 (x86) - English
http://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9815734

Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2012 (x64) - English
http://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9815744
Install the redist files from your "_CommonRedist" folder wich is inside your wargame folder.

If you get the msvcp110.dll missing error, it's because you didn't check the 3 boxes at the end of installation. Reinstall and check the 3 boxes and let it install Visual++. @RandomBS: easy to change the language; after installing and copying the cracked files edit the file named steam_rld.ini, scroll down and where it reads "Language=german" change to "Language=english". You can also edit the screen name from RLD to whatever you want.

When I try to move the steam.api file it tells me I need permission from all users and I don't have permission to move it. I don't see how it makes any sense seeing as how I'm the only user of this computer and I'm the administrator. Windows 7 by the way.

@BAWxMURDOCHx:

on Win7 there is a folder called GAMES. Right click on that folder and select properties, then go to SECURITY and hit EDIT for all users, one by one, checking the boxes in lower window. When done, proceed with installation but point the wizzard to GAMES folder. That should fix it.
@CFJack I found a folder titled games not in caps and did as you said but I get the same message, nothing I've done helps so far. Thanks for the suggestion though.
Just make sure to install x86 and x64 vcc 2012, and change the steam_rld to english. If you cant get it to work you are not meant to play the game :p
